title: Create CI workflow with lint and test jobs
summary: Adds .github/workflows/ci.yml with three parallel jobs (lint, unit-test, integration-test) on ubuntu-latest with Go 1.24, triggered on push to main and all pull_request events. Reference documentation added at docs/reference/backend/ci-workflow.md.

tests_checklist.item: CI workflow YAML is syntactically valid
All three jobs run in parallel (no needs: keys)
Unit test command matches spec: go test -race -count=1 ./...
Integration test command matches spec: go test -race -count=1 -run Integration ./...

code_quality_checklist.item: Follows GitHub Actions conventions (pinned action versions, step names)
No duplicated configuration across jobs beyond necessary checkout+setup
Lint job includes all five checks in correct order
Go version consistent across all jobs (1.24)
No dead code or commented-out blocks

security_checklist.item: Action versions pinned to major versions (v4, v5, v6)
No write permissions escalation (uses default read)
go mod verify validates dependency integrity

architecture_checklist.item: Solution is minimal â€” single YAML file with three jobs
Jobs are independent and parallel as specified
Trigger config matches requirements (push main + PR)
Module caching handled by setup-go@v5 automatically

dry_yagni_checklist.item: No unnecessary abstractions or reusable workflows
No extra jobs or steps beyond spec

fail_fast_checklist.item: Each step fails immediately on error (default shell behavior)
go mod verify runs first in lint job to catch dependency issues early

defensive_checklist.item: Race detection enabled on both test jobs

suggested_improvements: Consider pinning actions to full SHA hashes (e.g. actions/checkout@<sha>) for supply-chain hardening, though major version tags are acceptable for most projects
Consider adding a timeout-minutes on each job to prevent runaway CI from consuming unlimited minutes
